## Introduction

```{r}
#| label: setup
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.notes}
Don't forget to drop this important penguin fact.
:::


There are three main penguin species in Antarctica (*Chinstrap*, *Gentoo*, *Adelie*).

```{r}
#| label: illustration
#| fig-align: center
#| out-width: "60%"
knitr::include_graphics("images/lter_penguins.png")
```

## Introduction

In this paper we want to answer the following questions

::: {.incremental}

- How bill depth depends on bill length?
- Which penguin species has the highest body mass?

:::

## The data

- The data was collected on islands in Antarctica
- The paper was published by Gorman et al (2014)^[paper available [here](https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0090081).]

# Results

## Some numbers

```{r}
#| label: mean-penguin-species
#| include: false

# calculate the mean body mass of the penguin species
adelie_mean <- penguins |>
  filter(species == "Adelie") |>
  pull(body_mass) |>
  mean(na.rm = TRUE)
chinstrap_mean <- penguins |>
  filter(species == "Chinstrap") |>
  pull(body_mass) |>
  mean(na.rm = TRUE)
gentoo_mean <- penguins |>
  filter(species == "Gentoo") |>
  pull(body_mass) |>
  mean(na.rm = TRUE)
```

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}

The mean weight of

- all penguins: `{r} round(mean(penguins$body_mass, na.rm = TRUE))` g.
- *Gentoo* penguins: `{r} round(gentoo_mean,0)` g
- *Adelie* penguins of `{r} round(adelie_mean, 0)` g
- *Chinstrap* penguins of `{r} round(chinstrap_mean, 0)` g

:::

## A histogram of our penguins

::: {.panel-tabset}

### The plot

```{r}
#| label: hist
#| fig-align: center
#| fig-width: 4
#| fig-height: 3
#| echo: false

ggplot(penguins, aes(x = body_mass, fill = species)) +
  geom_histogram(alpha = 0.6) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("darkorange", "purple", "cyan4")) +
  theme_minimal()
```

### The code

```{r}
#| label: hist-code
#| echo: true
#| eval: false

ggplot(penguins, aes(x = body_mass, fill = species)) +
  geom_histogram(alpha = 0.6) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("darkorange", "purple", "cyan4")) +
  theme_minimal()
```

:::

## A scatterplot

```{r}
#| label: scatter
#| echo: true
#| output-location: column

ggplot(
  data = penguins,
  aes(
    x = bill_len,
    y = bill_dep,
    color = species,
    shape = species
  )
) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  scale_color_manual(
    values = c(
      "darkorange",
      "purple",
      "cyan4"
    )
  ) +
  theme_bw()
```

## Some very interesting penguin code

```{r}
#| label: summary
#| echo: true
#| code-line-numbers: "1,2"
penguins |>
  filter(!(is.na(sex))) |>
  summarize(
    bill_length = mean(bill_len, na.rm = TRUE),
    bill_depth = mean(bill_dep, na.rm = TRUE),
    flipper_length = mean(flipper_len, na.rm = TRUE),
    body_mass = mean(body_mass, na.rm = TRUE),
    .by = c(species, sex)
  )
```
